weekly_top_story.headline: South Korea to Triple Government Spending on Artificial Intelligence Infrastructure
weekly_top_story.summary: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung announced a plan to triple government investment in AI infrastructure and technology, signaling a strategic national push to become a global leader in artificial intelligence with broad implications for economic growth and technological innovation.

stories.headline: Typhoon Kalmaegi Leaves at Least 26 Dead and Causes Severe Flooding in the Philippines
stories.summary: Typhoon Kalmaegi has caused widespread devastation in the eastern Philippines, killing at least 26 people, displacing thousands, and flooding communities, highlighting the ongoing risks of climate-related disasters in Southeast Asia.

stories.headline: North Korea’s Longtime Ceremonial Head of State Kim Yong Nam Dies at Age 97
stories.summary: Kim Yong Nam, North Korea’s longtime ceremonial head of state, has died at 97, marking the end of an era in North Korea’s political symbolism amid ongoing global scrutiny of the regime.

stories.headline: At Least Two Killed and Five Foreign Climbers Missing After Avalanche in Nepal
stories.summary: An avalanche in Nepal has resulted in at least two deaths and left five foreign climbers missing in the Himalayan region, underscoring the persistent dangers of high-altitude mountaineering.
